elements.title: News(Top News : President Yoon Suk Yeol says Seoul's compensation plan for victims of Japan's wartime forced labor took into account respect for the victims as well as the shared interests and future of the two nations.) - 2023.03.07 PM5

News(Top News : South Korea announces that a government-led fund will compensate the Korean victims of Japan's wartime forced labor in lieu of Japanese companies, angering support groups.) - 2023.03.06 PM5
News(Top News : North Korea Denounces Seoul-Washington military drills as a 'War Rehearsal') - 2023.03.04 PM5
News(Top News : The South Korea-U.S. joint springtime military exercise will resume for the first time in five years to counter North Korea's nuclear threats.) - 2023.03.03 PM5
News(Top News : Schools across the nation begin their new academic year with entrance ceremonies held without the indoor mask mandate for the first time in four years.) - 2023.03.02 PM5
News(Top News : President Yoon Suk Yeol calls Japan a 'partner' in his March First Independence Movement Day Speech.) - 2023.03.01 PM5
News(Top News : The Democratic Party is rattled by the slim margin that saved its chief Lee Jae-myung from arrest in a National Assembly vote.) - 2023.02.28 PM5
News(Top News : The National Assembly votes on a motion sent by the prosecution to permit the arrest of Democratic Party chair Lee Jae-myung.) - 2023.02.27 PM5
News(Top News : President Yoon Suk Yeol visits the National Intelligence Service and urges the agency to showcase its capacity to neutralize North Korean provocations.) - 2023.02.25 PM5
News(Top News : Ruling and opposition parties are wrangling as a motion seeking consent to arrest the main opposition chief has been submitted to the parliament.) - 2023.02.24 PM5
